location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'A Journall of a Voyage intended pr God's permission in the Ship Thistleworth Bound to ye East Indies'

physicalDescription.extent: The entries are recorded in chronological order from the front to the rear of the volume.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 138; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: Journal of the voyage of the East India Company ship Thistleworthfrom England to Bombay [Mumbai, India], March-September 1714, from Bombay to Surat, India, November 1714, from Surat to Gombroon [Bandar Abbas, Iran], February-March 1714 [New Style date 1715], from Gombroon to Bombay, March-April 1715, and from Bombay to England, October 1715-May 1716 (Captain Daniel Small).The journal consists of daily entries of information on navigation, winds, weather, contact with other ships, deaths of crewmembers, and general observations.
